lead_paragraph: BERCK--Martin Gans. Died peacefully in Teaneck, NJ, at age 88. Martin was a beloved husband, father and grandfather, whose keen intelligence, humor, and insightfulness infused every interaction. A journalist with a specialty in foreign affairs, his long career spanned from copy boy at the New York Daily Mirror through eleven years at the New York Herald Tribune, and twenty at Newsday, where he was variously editor for foreign affairs, editorial writer and UN correspondent. He taught journalism at the Columbia School of Journalism and NYU; in 1968 he was a liaison between demonstrating Columbia students and the administration. A graduate of Bronx High School of Science, NYU and the Columbia School of Journalism, as a young journalist his reporting was credited with helping open the Soviet Union to Jewish emigration. An early steward on Pan American airlines, Martin adored travel and lifelong learning. He was passionate in many charitable causes, including a scholarship for Mexican children in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico, where he had a second home, as well as many Jewish causes. He will be greatly missed by his wife of 62 years, Lenore, and his children Jonathan (and spouse Suzy) of Garrison, NY, Judith (Bryan) of Portland, OR, and David (Iris) of Chappaqua, NY, and five grandchildren. 1/3
